name: The Prince Park Tower Tokyo

reviews.title: Good Hotel - shame about the price of the beer!
reviews.text: Superb hotel - has all that you need and it is huge!

reviews.title: Very nice; modern systems and fast service
reviews.text: Stayed here with a friend in January and its a great place. Very close to the public transport, well appointed and the staff are super helpful. For the price you get a great room (albeit a touch small but it is Tokyo after all) and superb service.

reviews.title: Service how it should be
reviews.text: Rooms are clean, have all that you need and have those crazy Japanese toilets - I could not work out how to turn down the toilet seat heater from scorching.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: The view from the bar at the top is breathtaking and well worth going for a look - if only to see the beautiful people who have arrived in their Ferraris. There are loads of restaurants which were great as well and you could eat in a different place almost every night of the week.

reviews.title: The best hotel!
reviews.text: The only issue I had with this place was that a small glass of beer in the bar was 10 UK pounds (when you converted from Yen) and a can was 4 in the hotel shop. I appreciate that Japan is expensive but that was a bit hard to swallow - or not as the case was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel which we booked at short notice for a very reasonable price. Initially we were allocated a smoking room in error, with views to the Rainbow Bridge. Once we pointed out the oversight,we were offered a HUGE room with king bed overlooking the Tokyo Tower. It was clean, nicely decorated and was a surprise after all we had heard about room sizes in Tokyo. A bonus for us was the green offer the hotel operates. One can request that one's room is not serviced (except for rubbish bins) and receive vouchers (2 x 500 yen) to spend in the hotel instead. This service can only be requested two days in a row. Thus if one stays for 7 days, with no service on days 2,3,5 &6, one can receive vouchers to the value of 4000 yen. For budget-conscious travellers, "earning" 1000 yen in vouchers (one collects them on the day of no service) allows one to buy treats at the very reasonably priced hotel shop, or other hotel services. Loved our stay here!
reviews.title: wow...and go green for hotel spending vouchers!
Great hotel
reviews.text: This was a great find the first thing is that the airport limo bus stops outside which is great for first time visitors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning beautiful with all the Xmas decorations we were upgraded when we arrived to a suite may I say it was bigger than my first unit this would be perfect for families as it is a 1bed unit 2 bathrooms 2toilets lounge room where both lounges turn into beds a little kitchenette the staff where wonderfully helpful and polite it is a long walk from ginza but there are several train lines near overall I would highly recommend this hotel and I will stay there next time we are in tokyo
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel staff and location

reviews.text: Just stayed here and had a wonderful time. We are from NYC and speak very little Japanese and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We had family in Japan that called the hotel numerous times and once again the staff was very patience and friendly while translating for us. The location is great! Tokyo is so big that I believe it’s hard to be centrally located however this was by subways, buses, etc. So getting around was easy. (Just as the front desk and they can help you with the subway routes.) Rooms were very comfortable. Restaurants at hotel were over priced but I guess that’s what you get for convenience. (Food was very good) The upstairs lounge that over looks the Tokyo Tower was nice however there is a fee to sit at a table. I would suggest checking out the Fish Market. We had a great lunch there that tasted just like our dinner at the hotel the night before at one third of the price. You do have to pay for gym which was about 20 bucks per person for a 24 hour period. So we were able to get to the gym two days in a row for the cost of one day. Just as a FYI, you are not allowed to use the pool/spa facilities with you have any visible tattoos. Husband and I both have some so we were not able to use those facilities which was a bummer, but we respect the culture so we couldn't complain. Overall it was a great hotel for our first visit to Japan. Not sure if we would stay there again next time because we would want to check out one of the other areas (since Tokyo is so big) but will definitely be looking for that chain to stay in. Hope you enjoy!
reviews.title: Very Luxurious and peaceful on 28th floor with amazing view

reviews.text: Very spacious beautiful view of Tokyo tower and skyline. Restaurants and cafe very overpriced (20 pounds for a coffeee and orange juice) but hotel shop good prices and well stocked with pastries, sandwiches etc. AVOID chinese restaurant - huge lifeless vacuum looks like a converted entertainment room with worst service I experienced in Japan- plate of pot noodle type noodles with beef and a beer 30 quid. Had I not been alone I would have walked out after first 5 mins. Guess you could say I should not try an eat Chinese food in Japan ;-). Friendly Hotel Bus stops here for airport although as its first stop it takes 45 mins to collect from other hotels. Short walk to subway or free bus to station. Approx 10 pounds per night reduction voucher if you opt for GREEN service - ie no room clean
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, in the heart of Tokyo. Part of a beautiful park, and next to the Tokyo tower ... an excellent place to walk around, day or night. The premium rooms are huge by Tokyo standards (or standards of any major city hotel), and very well appointed. The hotel's sushi restaurant is exceptional. The staff are extremely helpful. I've tried many hotels in Tokyo, and for a top hotel with great value, this is hard to beat. I will be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have always wanted to check out this hotel & finally we got to stay for one night.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel Near Tokyo Tower

reviews.text: Checking in a little late on a Saturday night we were unable to get a room with the Tokyo Tower view. So they put us into a half Japanese half western style room on the second floor. The room was very clean & spacious. No view but the room was very large.
reviews.title: Great value 5 star hotel in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is a bit off the tourist trek but still very easy to get around.
reviews.title: Luxurious end to our holiday

reviews.text: I will return but only if I can get a room high up with a Tokyo Tower view.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, Great service!
Great Staff - great property
reviews.text: This is a terrific hotel. The rooms have large windows, which in addition to great views, also give the rooms a lot of light and ambience. The bed is really comfortable, and I loved the bathtub with jets. You will also get used to the heated toilet seat.

reviews.title: Faultless experience
reviews.text: The location is also great, being walking distance to two subway stations on two separate lines that make transportation very convenient.

reviews.title: Great service
reviews.text: But the best thing about this hotel is the staff. They were incredibly helpful with everything we needed, from help in the pharmacy, to making restaurant reservations. They are a fantastic resource for guests and an asset to the property.

reviews.title: TEN out of TEN
reviews.text: Stayed here for 6 nights. I had stayed in Tokyo but not here, this was up with the best. I liked the quiet location and yet many things are easily accessible via train or metro. Tokyo Tower adjacent.

reviews.title: Top Notch
reviews.text: Warmly and personally welcomed and taken to room.

reviews.title: Convenient location, top-notch service
reviews.text: Stayed for an extended business trip. Excellent service, close to several metro stations, and just next door to an interesting Buddhist temple complex. Tokyo Tower is just down the street, and provides a dramatic view from the breakfast buffet on the 33rd floor. Modern design, very spacious room and bath. Convenience store on the street level is quite large and well stocked. No hesitation to book here again for a future visit.

First of all, this hotel is beautiful, inside and out. It is set on park grounds, with tons on green space surrounding the hotel - including a 2 & 5km jogging trail This was a great discovery in the middle of Tokyo.
reviews.title: Good balance of amenities and location

reviews.text: My room was spacious & well laid out. Furniture was functional, with a surprisingly good desk chair. The wifi for the hotel is divided by room, so there is great performance.
reviews.title: Impressive location

reviews.text: The hotel restaurants are located in the basement. They are not intuitive to find. You have to keep walking down the hall, taking several corners to get to the less expensive options.
reviews.title: nnice but pricy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise. I thout this Prince park tower was a good compromise. While it's a very ling walk from any attractions, it is a short train trip or cab to the imperial Gardens, ginza shopping district, tuna market and other tourist destinations.
reviews.title: One of our favorite hotels in Tokyo for business and leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent my birthday weekend at the Prince Park Tower, and I was more than delighted. The hotel was lovely, and we were treated beautifully by the staff. Our room was gorgeous; we upgraded to one of the executive floors, which was well worth it. Our view of Tokyo was fabulous. Our bed was huge and comfortable; linens were gorgeous; the bathroom was great - jacuzzi-type tub, separate shower, lots of lovely amenities. We had a view to the river, and also, below, of the Buddhist shrine complex. The hotel offers a shuttle to the JR station; there is also a bus to Narita, although we had JR passes, so took the JR line back to Narita. There are two subway stations within a short walk, different lines. Via subway, the hotel is close to Roppongi, with many restaurants and exciting nightlife. We found it convenient to go anywhere we needed to, and also, wonderful that it is surrounded by a park, so that there was not alot of traffic noise. The spa and baths were very nice. I won't need to look around for hotels next trip to Tokyo; we'll go back to the Prince Park.
reviews.title: Elegant and lovely

likes.liked: — The staff was very accomodating and the facility is fabulous
likes.disliked: — Waiting in the mornings for the breakfast buffet; apparently they overbook.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Prince Park Tower. On previous trips we had stayed nearby at the older Prince hotel and decided to stay at the Park Tower Prince because they have an executive lounge and I use it alot during the day.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff and beautiful views

likes.liked: — selection of restaurants and attentive staff
likes.disliked: — not much right outside the hotel.

reviews.text: The location is very similar to the older Prince so there isn't much outside the doors of the hotel. The location is good for my husband business meetings. And its close to Tokyo Tower.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have visited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can walk into Roponggi (sp?) for dinner and its about a 15 min walk. Lots of restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good hotel with convenient location

likes.liked: — The hotel provided good service, a large, clean room and was in a good location but was also quiet

reviews.text: The hotel is very new and looks it. They do have a fitness center and pool but there is an additional charge to use them.
reviews.title: Great View from the Tower

likes.liked: — Smoking a Cigar on a Balcony overlooking night-time Tokyo.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding Hotel. Location is exceptional. Fantastic views. Rooms are large and immaculate clean all the time. My first experience with a Toto Toilet left me angry at the American difficulties to get this in USA. Heated toilet seats are not rare in Japan but the Toto technology is Patent obstructed in USA. The hotel restaurants are expensive but in our case was included in the Tour hence, no problem with the price. The same applicable to room prices which are quite high (over U$250 a night for standard level) .The hotel computer access is outrageously expensive so, use an Internet café nearby as with the meals due to overpriced restaurants in the building.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service of the staff is outstanding and very cooperative for directions to the subway or the nearby areas of Shinjuku or Roppongi, the Imperial Palace or via metro-line to Asakusa, the soul of Tokyo and Senso-Ji Temple, the heart of Asakusa.
reviews.title: Fantastic service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a three night stay at the Prince Park Tower in the middle of October. The service from staff is fantastic, and the location is convenient for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Luxurious stay at Prince park tower

likes.liked: — all the gadgets and free stuff included in the great price
likes.disliked: — seems churlish to complain about a washing line

reviews.text: The hotel is a ~10min walk from JR Hamamatsucho Station, which is nice for those who have bought a JR Pass. There is also a hotel shuttle to and from the station which runs every half hour. The neighborhood is quiet and safe to walk around in.
reviews.title: Hospitality at its best

likes.liked: — Luxury, service, central location, parc surroundings

reviews.text: The hotel restaurants are very expensive and we did not try them. There are lots of good, reasonably priced restaurants near Hamamatsucho including working-man gyu-don places where you can an entire meal for $4.50USD.
reviews.title: Get more than you paid for in Tokyo

reviews.text: This hotel is located near a park so lots of space to walk around or jog if you prefer. But within 10 min of walk you can find restaurants, ATMs, super markets, drug stores etc, so very convenient too. The Tokyo tower is right cross the street and you can see it from many of the rooms. The airport shuttle from NRT and HND stops at this property and the concierge desk can book the shuttle. Room is of normal size with two beds (I was told they don't have single bed rooms). Breakfast buffet at the top floor is bountiful with both Japanese and western selections, and the breakfast bento in the Japanese restaurant in the basement is adequate (but I felt more people would go for the buffet). What strikes me most is how environment friendly the hotel is. They offer voucher to use in the hotel for agreeing not to have the room service (max 2 nights at one time), which is a smart way to save energy and cost. The soap is in a big bottle rather than the small individually wrapped pieces (which you usually can't finish in 2 days anyways). I think maybe other toileterries (shampoo, conditioner and bathsoap) can be the same with the option to request individual packages. During my stay I did not have many problems or requests but they were all addressed in a quick manner. When I used my voucher to buy some souvenir at the gift store, the clerk alerted me that the food item I was buying was expiring in 2 weeks and asked if I wanted an exchange. I was travelling to other places and this reminder did change my mind. The customer oriented service should be commended.
reviews.title: Green minded and flawless service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly i couldnt recommend the limousine bus more to get to this hotel, was just what we needed after a long flight. The check in process was fine no issues but the one thing we got when we first got into the room was a very pungent smell of seafood which we noticed was coming from the wardrobe, I remembered we talked about sorting it out in recpetion and maybe changing rooms straight away but we just couldnt be bothered. We kept the wardrobe closed the whole time and after the second day didnt notice the smell.
reviews.title: good location for subway access, fantastic bar

reviews.text: We went down to the mainbar on the basement level right after having a shower on our first night, wasnt very inspiring so we left and went to the skylounge on the 33rd flr instead. Despite reading other peoples comments about the priceyness of the bar we actually came back to the bar every single night of our 6 night stay. To be honest i didnt find the drinks too expensive and with the great view and fantastic staff (Especially Kaz who we got to know quite well and who's english was pretty good) why wouldnt you want to come up here after a long day of travelling to unwind! But hey everyone has a budget so i understand why this may have seemed pricey for some.
reviews.title: Good hotel with kids
Great rooms, expensive food.
reviews.text: Another bonus about the hotel which I havnt seen other people mention yet is the bowling saloon which is on B2 Level- what is this you may be thinking?... well you can play ten-pin bowling,billiards or darts. Not cheap i think for an hour of billiards it was 1500 yen per person or something along those lines but it offers something i have never come accross in another hotel before.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the cons besides the smell in our room:
reviews.title: A top notch choice for expensive Tokyo

aka: The Prince Park Tower Tokyo Hotel Minato
